abstract.t: The functionality provided by IPv6's Type 0 Routing Header can be exploited in order to achieve traffic amplification over a remote path for the purposes of generating denial-of-service traffic. This document updates the IPv6 specification to the use of a new IPv6 Type 4 Routing Header, in light of this security concern. This new header provides the same functionality of the Routing Header Type-0, while taking care of the major security concerns defined in the draft [draft-ietf-ipv6-deprecate-rh0-01].
